issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
I have attached pics of the current docs. "Generate Administrator Credentials" needs to be moved back to "Configure the Runtime Environment" from where it's been put under "Configure Eucalyptus". You can't generate admin creds before you start & register components. 

2 pics attached
fields.summary: "Generate Administrator Credentials" needs to be moved from "Configure Eucalyptus" to "Configure Runtime Environment"

comments.body: [~pweiss] and [~jkennedy], I sure thought we moved this already once or twice. [~scottb], can you shed light on this?
Hmm, we're also missing the link to earlier versions of installation docs at the bottom.

Yeah, that was moved to the TOC, per user studies.


On Fri, Aug 15, 2014 at 6:31 AM, Jason Kennedy (JIRA) <

Okay, [~scottb] and [~jkennedy], sorry for the confusion. I think I remember this now. I changed it per someone else (can't recall) because the networking configuration can't be done until admin creds are issued. And, since we have configuring networking modes in the Configuring Eucalyptus section, we just moved  the admin creds narrative up.

Not that it makes it correct. Just historical understanding.

So, now it seems we need to move the admin creds narrative back to the Runtime section *and* move the Networking Modes section to the Runtime section as well. If this is correct, do I put these old/new sections at the top of the Runtime section?

Hmm, my recollection is that I was asked to move the admin creds for Edge
configuration, because you need credentials for the JSON file configuration.

Then again, I could be mis-remembering. But there was a reason I moved it.
I'm a lazy ass, and I don't do anything without reason.


On Tue, Aug 19, 2014 at 2:24 PM, Jason Kennedy (JIRA) <

You do need the credentials for the JSON file configuration, but the command isn't going to work because you haven't started the services yet; you can't get admin creds because there's no DB to generate them, and you can't euca-modify-property when the system's down. 

You can recreate this failure as seen below: 

install the proper repos and eucalyptus-cloud & eucalyptus-walrus, on what is to be your CLC/Walrus. 

The next step in the 4.0.1 docs is to generate the admin creds

It will generate the following error: 

[root@odc-c-06 ~]# /usr/sbin/euca_conf --get-credentials admin.zip
[Errno 2] No such file or directory: '//var/lib/eucalyptus/keys/cloud-pk.pem'
[root@odc-c-06 ~]#

However, I understand what you're saying in regards to why it was probably changed. What do we do at this point, should we re-work the docs completely to move all parts that require credentials to further down in the docs? We'd have to scrub the documentation for everything that requires generation of admin credentials to make sure it's all pulled down, and it might mess with the flow. In my opinion, perhaps a reminder of some kind at the time of generation of creds (generate admin creds, and now go back and set blockstoragemanager etc) to do the things you need to do. 

Does that makes sense? How can I help with this?

Yep, makes perfect sense. Thanks, Jason. I think you're suggestion about
rewriting the install docs is a great one. At least the actual install
tasks. It's a lot of work as it is. I'm still optimistic enough to think we
can do a better job (at the very least give users a workflow in which they
won't encounter errors).

I'll probably need help with what folks can do before starting and
registering. And then what folks can and should do afterwards.


On Tue, Aug 19, 2014 at 3:05 PM, Jason Kennedy (JIRA) <
Seems like a simple pointer could make this work for now. imo this is a Blocker, since clearly folks who are new to Eucalyptus get completely stumped.

[~lwade], thanks for the reminder, Lester. 

Should we move the entire Configure Networking Modes section from Configure Eucalyptus to Configure the Runtime Environment? Or, should move the JSON part of the Edge configuration section to Configure the Runtime Environment? Or something else?

For now I would suggest we put a note in before this bit:

{quote}Run the following command to upload the configuration file to the CLC (with valid eucalyptus/admin credentials sourced):
euca-modify-property -f cloud.network.network_configuration=</path/to/your/config_file.json>{quote}

Perhaps we just say "You will not be able to run this command until you have your credentials from Section X Step 4".
Created a note for 4.0.1. Waiting for a push to the production site.
Docs published for 4.0.1. Leaving this ticket open because we need a more elegant way to present this for our customers at 4.0.2.
Pushing this out to 4.1.0 because I'll be doing a re-write of the install guide then.
